de.mrapp.android.sidebar

Class Sidebar

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • de.mrapp.android.sidebar.Sidebar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class Sidebar
extends android.view.ViewGroup
    A custom view, which allows to show a sidebar, which overlaps the view's main content and can be shown or hidden in an animated manner. The sidebar may be located at left or right edge of the parent view and its state can be changed by either calling an appropriate method or via dragging on the device's touch screen. Furthermore there are a lot of attributes, which allow to specify the appearance and behavior of the sidebar.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static float DEFAULT_ANIMATION_SPEED
      The default speed of the animation, which is used to show or hide the sidebar, in dp per millisecond.
      protected static ContentMode DEFAULT_CONTENT_MODE
      The default content mode, which specifies how the content view is handled when the sidebar becomes shown or hidden.
      protected static int DEFAULT_CONTENT_OVERLAY_COLOR
      The default color of the overlay, which is shown in front of the main content, when the sidebar is shown.
      protected static float DEFAULT_CONTENT_OVERLAY_TRANSPARENCY
      The default transparency of the overlay, which is shown in front of the main content, when the sidebar is shown.
      protected static DragMode DEFAULT_DRAG_MODE_WHEN_HIDDEN
      The default drag mode, which specifies the region, where drag gestures are recognized, when the sidebar is currently hidden.
      protected static DragMode DEFAULT_DRAG_MODE_WHEN_SHOWN
      The default drag mode, which specifies the region, where drag gestures are recognized, when the sidebar is currently shown.
      protected static float DEFAULT_DRAG_SENSITIVITY
      The default sensitivity, which specifies the distance after which dragging has an effect on the sidebar, in relation to an internal value range.
      protected static float DEFAULT_DRAG_THRESHOLD
      The default distance, the sidebar has to be dragged until its state changes, in relation to the whole distance.
      protected static boolean DEFAULT_HIDE_ON_BACK_BUTTON
      Specifies, whether by default the sidebar should be hidden, when the device's back button is clicked, or not.
      protected static boolean DEFAULT_HIDE_ON_CONTENT_CLICK
      Specifies, whether by default the sidebar should be hidden, when the main content is clicked by the user, or not.
      protected static Location DEFAULT_LOCATION
      The default location of the sidebar.
      protected static int DEFAULT_MAX_SIDEBAR_OFFSET
      The default maximum offset of the sidebar in dp or -1, if the sidebar's offset should not be restricted.
      protected static int DEFAULT_MAX_SIDEBAR_WIDTH
      The default maximum width of the sidebar in dp or -1, if the sidebar's width should not be restricted.
      protected static float DEFAULT_SCROLL_RATIO
      The default ratio between the distance, the sidebar is moved by, when it becomes shown or hidden, in relation to the distance, the content is moved by.
      protected static boolean DEFAULT_SHOW_ON_SIDEBAR_CLICK
      Specifies, whether by default the sidebar should be shown, when it is clicked by the user, or not.
      protected static int DEFAULT_SIDEBAR_ELEVATION
      The default elevation of the sidebar in dp.
      protected static float DEFAULT_SIDEBAR_OFFSET
      The default amount of space in relation to the width of the parent view, the sidebar is visible, even if it is currently hidden.
      protected static float DEFAULT_SIDEBAR_WIDTH
      The default width of the sidebar in relation to the width of its parent view.
      protected static boolean SHOW_SIDEBAR_BY_DEFAULT
      True, if the sidebar should be shown by default, false otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sidebar

        public Sidebar(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new custom view, which allows to show a sidebar, which overlaps the view's main content and can be shown or hidden in an animated manner.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the sidebar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • Sidebar

        public Sidebar(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @Nullable
               android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new custom view, which allows to show a sidebar, which overlaps the view's main content and can be shown or hidden in an animated manner. This constructor is called when a preference is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the context's theme and the given attribute set.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the sidebar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained

      • Sidebar

        public Sidebar(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @Nullable
               android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
               int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new custom view, which allows to show a sidebar, which overlaps the view's main content and can be shown or hidden in an animated manner. This constructor allows subclasses to use their own base style when they are inflating.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the sidebar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • Sidebar

        public Sidebar(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @Nullable
               android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
               int defaultStyle,
               int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new custom view, which allows to show a sidebar, which overlaps the view's main content and can be shown or hidden in an animated manner. This constructor allows subclasses to use their own base style when they are inflating.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the sidebar should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

      • getScrollRatio

        public final float getScrollRatio()
        Returns the ratio between the distance, the sidebar is moved by, when it becomes shown or hidden, in relation to the distance, the content is moved by.
        Returns:
        The scroll ratio as a Float value. The scroll ratio must be at least 0 and at maximum 1. If set to 1.0, the content is moved exactly as far as the sidebar, if set to 0.0, the content is not moved at all. The scroll ratio does only apply, if the content mode is set to SCROLL

      • setScrollRatio

        public final void setScrollRatio(float scrollRatio)
        Sets the ratio between the distance, the sidebar is moved by, when it becomes shown or hidden, in relation to the distance, the content is moved by.
        Parameters:
        scrollRatio - The scroll ratio, which should be set, as a Float value. The scroll ratio must be at least 0 and at maximum 1. If set to 1.0, the content will be moved exactly as far as the sidebar, if set to 0.0, the content will not be moved at all. The scroll ratio will only apply, if the content mode is set to SCROLL
